init.title: Memory settings
init.description:
Configure service-level memory behavior shared by all conversation agents in this provider entry.

Memory panel:
- Sidebar item: `AI Assist Memory`
- Route: `/ai-subscription-assist-memory`

Memory slash commands (use in Assist chat):
- `/memory help`
- `/memory status`
- `/memory add [--shared] <text>` (alias: `/remember`)
- `/memory list [mine|shared|all] [--limit N]`
- `/memory search <query> [--limit N]` (alias: `/memories`)
- `/memory delete <memory_id>` (alias: `/forget`)
- `/memory clear mine|shared|all --confirm`
- `/memory sessions [mine|all] [--limit N]` (alias: `/sessions`)
- `/memory sessions show <session_id> [--limit N]`
- `/memory sessions clear <session_id|mine|all> --confirm`
- `/new` or `/reset` to clear resumable context and start fresh

Addon services for memory/session management:
- `claude_assist.memory_status`
- `claude_assist.memory_list`
- `claude_assist.memory_delete`
- `claude_assist.memory_clear`
- `claude_assist.session_list`
- `claude_assist.session_get`
- `claude_assist.session_clear`

For Home Assistant timeline/history questions, enable these agent tools:
`get_history`, `get_logbook`, `get_statistics`

data_description.memory_enabled: Master switch for long-term memory and slash memory commands.
data_description.memory_auto_write: Capture explicit phrases like 'remember that ...' into per-user memory.
data_description.memory_auto_recall: Inject relevant memory snippets into the system prompt for normal chat turns.
data_description.memory_resume_enabled: Persist recent transcript context so Assist can continue after dialog reopen.
data_description.memory_ttl_days: Automatically expire memories older than this many days.
data_description.memory_max_items_per_scope: Cap memory items for each scope (shared and each user).
data_description.memory_recall_top_k: Maximum number of memory items injected per turn.
data_description.memory_resume_max_messages: Maximum number of user/assistant messages kept for resumable context.

abort.entry_not_loaded: Cannot add things while the configuration is disabled.

data.max_tokens: Maximum tokens to return in response

init.description:
Configure this agent's model and tool access.

For timeline/history analysis in chat, enable `get_history`, `get_logbook`, and `get_statistics` in **Enabled custom tools**.
Memory slash commands are configured at the integration level (Integration → Configure).

data_description.enabled_tools: Choose which extra AI Subscription Assist tools this agent can call.
data_description.prompt: Instruct how the LLM should respond. This can be a template.
data_description.yolo_mode: Disables exposure safeguards and unlocks privileged tools (dashboard/automation edits, log access). Use only for trusted agents.

init.title: Basic settings

data_description.thinking_budget: The number of tokens the model can use to think about the response out of the total maximum number of tokens. Set to 1024 or greater to enable extended thinking.
data_description.thinking_effort: Control how many tokens Claude uses when responding, trading off between response thoroughness and token efficiency
data_description.user_location: Localize search results based on home location
data_description.web_search: The web search tool gives Claude direct access to real-time web content, allowing it to answer questions with up-to-date information beyond its knowledge cutoff
data_description.web_search_max_uses: Limit the number of searches performed per response
